Example 26.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new date-time attribute with a specified guid for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database. The same thing can be done for all attribute types.

Example 27.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new discrete attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000), using the 'Material type' discrete type, from the MI_Training database.

You can change the attribute back to a single-valued one as long as there is no multi-valued data already existing.

Example 31.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new integer attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database.

Example 33.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new logical attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database.

Example 38.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new point attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) to represent a multi-valued property with the unit of 'kg' from the MI_Training database. get.summary: Check whether the API is available

GrantaServerApiSearchCriterion.description:
The criterion to be used in a search.
            
Multiple criterion can be provided. These should be wrapped with a boolean criterion that specifies whether the search should return results that match "any", "all", or "none" of the criterion.
These criterion can be nested to created complex search queries.

aggregationCriteria.description: The aggregations you wish to perform.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsAggregationsR.description:
A request for aggregation information from a particular scope. The type of information
requested can vary: for example, for attributes, it could be a request for minimum/maximum
values, or for common text terms.
            
An aggregation request is associated with a particular scope (database, table, integration
schema, etc) based off the API invoked; however, the scope can be further narrowed down by
providing a criterion in the aggregation request. Only data from records matching that
criterion will be considered when aggregating data.
            
Note that only some types of criterion will be supported: in particular, criteria that involve
"matches" criteria against functional attributes, or link-attribute criteria against record
link groups, are not eligible to be used as an aggregation query criterion.

GrantaServerApiAttributeType.description: The types of attribute that are supported by the API.

guid.description:
The GUID of this object. The GUID represents the object on a semantic level, and two objects of
the same type with the same GUID are considered to represent "the same concept". GUIDs should be
robust against data changes and database upgrades, and should be preferred where possible.

name.description:
The name of this object. The name represents the object at a human-readable level, but two objects of
the same type with the same need not represent "the same concept". Because the name is less uniquely identifying,
clients should prefer GUIDs where possible, and operations based on name instead of GUID may fail if the name
cannot be uniquely resolved. Certain object types may consider names to be equivalent

identity.description:
The underlying identity of this object. This represents the object at a data level, and two objects
of the same type with the same identity are considered to represent "the same object". However, identities
are not robust against database upgrades, and are only reliable and consistent within a currently-
loaded database in a running MI instance. Clients should prefer GUIDs where possible, and operations
based on identity which persist data will be resolved to GUIDs instead (and may fail if this cannot
be done).

GrantaServerApiObjectIdentifier.description:
Properties that identify an object within the MI system.
            
An Granta.Server.Api.ObjectIdentifier created by MI will always contain values for all three
properties. An Granta.Server.Api.ObjectIdentifier created by a client need not contain values for
all three properties, and is allowed to contain values or combinations of values that do
not correspond to an existing object in MI (in which case the Granta.Server.Api.ObjectIdentifier
will be resolved against MI objects first by GUID, and then by name, and finally by identity,
taking the first match and ignoring subsequent fields.

unitSymbol.description: If isUnitted is true, then this must have a non empty value

discreteTypeIdentity.description: A discrete attribute must define the identity of its discrete type (i.e. list of possible values)

parameters.description: A float functional attribute must define a list of parameters.

graphType.description: A float functional attribute must be either a Series or a Grid type graph.

xAxisParameter.description: A float functional attribute must define an x-axis. This will be one of the parameters listed in parameters

GrantaServerApiIntegrationSchemaAttribut.description: An attribute as defined in an integration schema.

GrantaServerApiIntegrationSchemaLayout.description: An integration schema layout is named list of attribute identities.

GrantaServerApiIntegrationSchemaDiscrete.description: An integration schema discrete type defines the list of values that a discrete attribute can take.

GrantaServerApiIntegrationSchemaLinkSour.description:
Source links for an integration schema can either be static (within an single database), or cross database. Cross database links
must indicate which database they are defined in - a reverse cross database link is defined in the "target" database of the mapped
integration schema attribute.

targetIdentity.description: The identity of the integration schema attribute

parameterMappings.description:
Any mapped parameters (float functional attributes only). The target parameters must be defined on the target integration attribute.
Not every parameters from the source database needs to be mapped for each attribute.

GrantaServerApiIntegrationSchemaMapping.description: A mapping between a source database item and an integration schema attribute.

mappings.description: Mappings for items from this table to the integration schema attributes.

GrantaServerApiIntegrationSchemaSource.description: A source table from which integrated data will be taken.

readGroup.description: Members of this groups can read data from the integration schema.

adminGroup.description: Members of this group can perform administrative tasks such as adding or deleting the schema.

GrantaServerApiIntegrationSchemaSecurity.description: The security groups that apply to an integration schema. If null or empty, the default MI security groups will be used.

GrantaServerApiIntegrationSchemaIntegrat.description:
A type representing an integration schema. An integration schema is a schema that describes
a shape that data must conform to, similar to an MI schema, but unlike an MI schema, an
integration schema does not have any corresponding data stored in it. Instead, an integration
schema defines mappings or transformations from existing stored data, which may be a different
shape from the integration schema.

GrantaServerApiRecordProperty.description:
A record property represents data on a record that typically cannot be independently edited,
as opposed to attribute data which may be edited on a record freely (albeit possibly requiring
releasing a new version). Record properties are usually tracked by the system automatically
and are usually read-only.
Note: for legacy reasons, some 'record properties' do not fall into these criteria, and do
represent editable record fields more similar to attribute data. These record properties are
usually exposed in this API as both 'record properties' and 'pseudo-attributes'.

GrantaServerApiDataExportDataExportReque.description: Request object for exporting the attribute data from a list of records

GrantaServerApiIntegrationDataExportReco.description: The unique way to identify a record history (which may have multiple versions) in an MI system

failures.description: List the records that were requested, but that we failed to export any data for.

recordReferences.description: A list of records to export. These are references to the underlying records in the source database

attributeIdentities.description: A list of attribute to export. These are the attribute identities from the integration schema.

error.description: This is the error message from the indexing exception. It may have been returned directly from Elasticsearch.

recordWasOversized.description:
Records that contain a large amount of data are intentionally not sent to the index. This size limit is configurable through
MIServer.exe.config

GrantaServerApiIntegrationIndexRecordFai.description:
Detail of a record that has failed to successfully index. A record that was not indexed will not be returned
as a result in any searches.

loadedDatabases.description: Loaded databases have been successfully indexed into the integration schema. Data from them will be available in searches.

loadingDatabases.description: Databases which are in the process of loading.

notLoadedDatabases.description:
Databases that are referenced in the schema but that are not yet loaded. This could be because they are still queued for
load in the MI system, or because they have not yet been added.

outOfSyncDatabases.description:
These databases have been loaded, but some data has not made it to Elasticsearch. They are available for searching, but results
may not be accurate.

erroredDatabases.description: Databases that encountered an error while loading. These databases will not be available for searches.

GrantaServerApiListsDtoListCriterion.description:
The criterion to be used in a search for record lists.
            
Multiple criterion can be provided. These should be wrapped with a boolean criterion that specifies whether the search should return results that match "any" or "all" of the criteria.
These criteria can be nested to created complex search queries.

startIndex.description: The index of the first list in the collection to be returned. If not provided it will start at index 0.

pageSize.description: The number of lists to be returned per page. If not provided the number of returned lists will be unlimited.

GrantaServerApiListsDtoRecordListResourc.description: Contains the URI of a resource

isOwner.description:
Flag indicating if the user or group is an owner of this list.
Null means: do not change this flag's value when inserting into database.

isSubscribed.description:
Flag indicating if the user or group is subscribed to this list.
Null means: do not change this flag's value when inserting into database.

isCurator.description:
Flag indicating if the user or group is a curator of this list.
Null means: do not change this flag's value when inserting into database.

isAdministrator.description:
Flag indicating if the user or group is an administrator of this list.
Null means: do not change this flag's value when inserting into database.

isPublisher.description:
Flag indicating if this user or group is a publisher of this list.
Null means: do not change this flag's value when inserting into database.

GrantaServerApiSchemaLayoutsLayoutSectio.description: The types of detail returned for a layout section.

GrantaServerApiSchemaLayoutsNewLayoutIte.description: The types of new layout item that are supported by the API.

key.description: Key is a unique identifier of a profile. Separate from guid.

guid.description: Guid is a unique identifier of a profile. Separate from key.

GrantaServerApiSchemaSlimEntitiesSlimPro.description: Profile stripped down to only the basic fields

GrantaServerApiSchemaAllProfilesInfo.description: Object containing list of all profiles as well as default profile if it is set and can be found within the list.

GrantaServerApiSchemaSlimEntitiesSlimPro.description: Profile table stripped to just the basic fields

key.description: Key is a unique identifier of a profile. Separate from guid.

guid.description: Guid is a unique identifier of a profile. Separate from key.

GrantaServerApiSchemaProfile.description: A profile, consisting of a set of tables from one or more databases.

GrantaServerApiSchemaProfileTable.description: A table within a profile. Contains display customization.

GrantaServerApiSchemaUnitsUnitSystem.description:
Unit system contains mappings from any unit to equivalent unit within this unit system.
If some unit comes from particular unit system it will be mapped to itself.

GrantaServerApiSchemaSlimEntitiesSlimUni.description: Unit system stripped down to its basic fields (mappings excluded).

pageSize.description: The number of results that should be returned in each page

keepAliveInMinutes.description: The length of time that the paginated search should be kept in memory

pageNumber.description: (Optional) the (1-indexed) number of the page to return from the search. No pages are returned if not provided

GrantaServerApiSearchPagingOptions.description: An optional field for paging options. If provided on a request, the response will contain an identifier that can be used to retrieve the other pages. Page size must be smaller than 10,000

sortCriteria.description: An optional set of attribute based sort criteria. If none are provided, the results will be sorted in descending relevance order.

searchIdentifier.description: If the search request had paging options specified, this will return an identifier that can be used to get the rest of the results

pageNumber.description:
The (1-indexed) number of the page to return from a search
The size of the page was determined by the original query

GrantaServerApiSearchAttributeCriterion.description: Base class for attribute criterions. The attribute identity must be provided.

GrantaServerApiSearchDatumCriterion.description: Inner criterion of an attribute search criterion. The specific criterion used should match the type of the attribute specified on the outer criterion (Note that there are multiple types that can be used with a discrete attribute, depending on the type of search.)

GrantaServerApiSearchAttributeMatchesCri.description: Criterion for a search matching values in a given attribute. The attribute identity must be provided.

GrantaServerApiSearchDatumExistsCriterio.description: Inner criterion of an attribute search criterion for when the only bit of information about the datum that we want to convey is its type

GrantaServerApiSearchAttributeExistsCrit.description: Criterion for matching record where there is data on the attribute specified. The attribute identity must be provided.

GrantaServerApiSearchAttributeNotApplica.description: Criterion for matching record where there is not applicable data on the attribute specified. The attribute identity must be provided.

all.description: Only records that match all of these criteria are returned.

any.description: Only results that match any of these criteria are returned.

none.description: Only results that match none of these criteria are returned.

GrantaServerApiSearchBooleanCriterion.description: boolean: Criterion that wraps other criteria in order to specify how the results should be joined together.

GrantaServerApiSearchFreeTextCriterion.description: Runs a query for the specified term. An optional list of attribute identities is provided - if this is missing (null), we search everything; if it's empty, we'll return nothing.

GrantaServerApiSearchRecordListMemberCri.description: Criterion that returns records contained within at least one of the referenced record lists.

GrantaServerApiSearchSearchableRecordPro.description: Properties of a record that can be used to in searches

GrantaServerApiSearchRecordPropertyCrite.description: Criterion for a search matching values in a given record property.

GrantaServerApiSearchRecordReferenceCrit.description: Criterion that returns records matching a specific reference. The database key must be provided, along with either the record GUID or the record identity.

GrantaServerApiSearchRecordAncestorCrite.description: Criterion that returns records with a specific parent or ancestor. If no ancestor identity is provided, returns records that sit directly below the table

GrantaServerApiSearchRecordSubsetCriteri.description: Criterion that returns records matching a specific subset. The database key must be provided, along with either the subset GUID or the subset identity.

GrantaServerApiSearchLinkingValueMatchBe.description: Enum for use in the Granta.Server.Api.Search.TabularLinkingValueCriterion to control which tabular rows are returned

GrantaServerApiSearchDateTimeDatumCriter.description: dateTime: Criterion for matching records where the datetime data is within the given bounds. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search.

constraints.description: Optional unit string. If not included, the gte and lte values are assumed to be in database units.

GrantaServerApiSearchDiscreteFunctionalR.description: discreteFunctionalRange: Criterion for matching records with discrete functional data where the discrete values are in the given range. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search

any.description: Match any of these discrete type identities

constraints.description: Constraints on the parameters of the attribute. Unspecified parameters will be assumed to be unconstrained.

GrantaServerApiSearchDiscreteFunctionalV.description: discreteFunctionalValues: Criterion for matching records with discrete functional data where the discrete values are one of the given values

all.description: Match all of these discrete value identities

any.description: Match any of these discrete type identities

none.description: Match none of the discrete type identities

GrantaServerApiSearchDiscreteIdentityVal.description: discreteIdentityValues: Criterion for matching records where the discrete data matches any, all and/or none of the provided discrete value identities. One or more field can be null.

GrantaServerApiSearchDiscreteRangeDatumC.description: discreteRange: Criterion for matching records for where the discrete values are in the given range. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search

GrantaServerApiSearchDiscreteTextDatumCr.description: discreteText: Criterion for matching records where the text of the discrete data contains the specified value.

GrantaServerApiSearchDiscreteTextValuesD.description: discreteTextValues: Criterion for matching records where the text in the discrete data matches all, any and/or none of the specified text strings. One of more field can be null.

unit.description: Optional unit string. If not included, the gte and lte values are assumed to be in database units.

constraints.description: Constraints on the parameters of the attribute. Unspecified parameters will be assumed to be unconstrained.

GrantaServerApiSearchFloatFunctionalDatu.description: floatFunctional: Criterion for matching records with float functional data

numberOfSeriesLte.description: Optional filter for the number of series.

numberOfSeriesGte.description: Optional filter for the number of series.

showAsTable.description: Optional filter for data on the "Show as table" property

GrantaServerApiSearchFloatFunctionalGrap.description: floatFunctional: Criterion for matching records with float functional data

GrantaServerApiSearchHyperlinkDatumCrite.description: hyperlink: Criterion for matching records where the hyperlink description contains the given value.

GrantaServerApiSearchIntegerDatumCriteri.description: integer: Criterion for matching records where the integer data is within the given bounds. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search.

targetDatabaseKey.description: Database containing the linked records. For reverse cross database links, this is the database where the link is defined

targetAttributeIdentity.description:
For tabular searching: this is the identity of the short-text linking attribute.
Otherwise null.

GrantaServerApiSearchLinkDatumCriterion.description:
link: Criterion for matching records that are linked to records that match the inner criterion. The target database and table specify the location of the linked records.
The inner criterion must be a criterion that applies to the records in the linked table. The link group followed will be the link group specified on the outer AttributeCriterion.

unit.description: Optional unit string. If not included, the gte and lte values are assumed to be in database units.

constraints.description: Constraints on the parameters of the attribute. Unspecified parameters will be assumed to be unconstrained.

GrantaServerApiSearchMathsFunctionalDatu.description: mathsFunctional: Criterion for matching records with maths functional data (EELs)

GrantaServerApiSearchPictureDatumCriteri.description: picture: Criterion for matching records where picture data exists.

GrantaServerApiSearchPointDatumCriterion.description:
Criterion for matching records where the point data is within the given bounds. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search.
If this is a unitted attribute, the search values should be given in terms of the units defined for the attribute in the database/integration schema.

GrantaServerApiSearchRangeDatumCriterion.description:
Criterion for matching records where the range data is within the given bounds. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search.
If this is a unitted attribute, the search values should be given in terms of the units defined for the attribute in the database/integration schema.

scaleType.description: Optionally, override the scale type of the parameter. Can be Linear or Log

interpolationType.description: Optionally, override the interpolation type of the parameter. Can be Auto, None, Linear or CubicSpline

GrantaServerApiSearchAttributeSortCriter.description: Specifies an attribute based sort criterion for a search query. Either the name or identity of the sorting attribute must be provided.

GrantaServerApiSearchRecordPropertySortC.description: Specifies a record property based sort criterion for a search query.

GrantaServerApiSearchRelevanceSortCriter.description: Specifies a relevance based sort criterion for a search query

GrantaServerApiSchemaTabularColumnsTabul.description: The roll up types of a tabular column.

GrantaServerApiSchemaLayoutsLayoutItemTy.description: The types of layout item that are supported by the API.

GrantaServerApiSchemaLayoutsLayoutItemLi.description: The types of layout items that represent links to another table.

GrantaServerApiListsDtoListBooleanCriter.description: listBoolean: Criterion that wraps other criteria in order to specify how the results should be joined together. Used in searches for record lists.

GrantaServerApiListsDtoUserRole.description: A set of flags that can be used to describe the role or roles that a user has on a particular record list

isRevision.description: Restrict to record lists that are (non discarded) revisions.

containsRecordsInDatabases.description: Limits results to lists containing records in any of of the specified databases

containsRecordsInIntegrationSchemas.description: Limits results to lists containing records in any of the specified integration schemas

containsRecordsInTables.description: Limits results to lists containing records in any of the specified tables

containsRecords.description: Limits results to lists containing any of the given records

userCanAddOrRemoveItems.description: Limits results to lists where the current user can add or remove items.

GrantaServerApiListsDtoRecordListSearchC.description:
recordList: Search criterion for a set of record lists.
            
The properties in the this class represent an AND search - only lists that match all of the non-null properties will be returned

GrantaServerApiRecordColor.description: An API-level enum for the supported record colors.

GrantaServerApiRecordType.description: An API-level enum for the supported record types.

GrantaServerApiVersionState.description: API-level enum for version control state.

attributeIdentity.description: The identity of the attribute that was aggregated over.

count.description:
The number of records that have a populated (applicable) value for this attribute.
(For multi-valued attributes: the number of records that have one or more populated
(applicable) values for this attribute.)
            
For a tabular attribute, this will be the number of records that have at least one
tabular row in this attribute, even if those rows might be filtered out from users'
views in some clients.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsAttributeAggr.description:
The results of aggregation over an attribute. In all cases this will report the number of records in
the aggregation scope that have a value for the attribute. In some cases, depending on the attribute
type, we may be able to report more information. For example, aggregating over a numeric attribute will
also provide the minimum and maximum values that attribute takes across records in the aggregation
scope.

guid.description: The GUID of the input aggregation criterion.

terms.description:
The topmost terms in the specified attributes, across all relevant records. Due to how
matches in multiple attributes are reconciled, we cannot easily provide a document count,
nor can we guarantee that the terms are perfectly correctly ordered.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsFreeTextAggre.description: The results of aggregation over an attribute.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsAttributeAggr.description: A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific attribute or meta-attribute.

criterionGuid.description:
A GUID to identify this free-text criterion, so that its results can be determined in the output.
For each input free-text aggregation criterion, there will be a free-text aggregation in the output
with a matching GUID.

numberOfTerms.description: The number of terms that should be returned

GrantaServerApiAggregationsFreeTextAggre.description: A criterion for requesting a free text aggregation over a set of identities.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsDateTimeAggre.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a datetime attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the minimum and maximum
values, and a count of records with a value for the attribute.

numberOfTerms.description:
The maximum number of terms to return in this aggregation. If this is not provided,
or if an invalid value is provided, then a default value of 10 will be assumed.

prefix.description:
An optional textual prefix. If provided, only terms that start with this prefix will be
considered in the aggregation.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsDiscreteTextA.description:
Criterion for aggregating textual data within a discrete attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the most common
terms for the attribute across records in the aggregation scope, with a count of records for each term.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsIntegerAggreg.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within an integer attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the minimum and maximum
values, and a count of records with a value for the attribute.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsPointAggregat.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a point attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the minimum and maximum
values (in database units), and a count of records with at least one value for the attribute.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsRangeAggregat.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a range attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the minimum and maximum
values (in database units), and a count of records with a value for the attribute.
            
As in MI elsewhere, a range with only one boundary specified is treated like a point, rather than an infinitely large range.

numberOfTerms.description:
The maximum number of terms to return in this aggregation. If this is not provided,
or if an invalid value is provided, then a default value of 10 will be assumed.

prefix.description:
An optional textual prefix. If provided, only terms that start with this prefix will be
considered in the aggregation.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsShortTextAggr.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a short-text attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the most common
terms for the attribute across records in the aggregation scope, with a count of records for each term.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsLinkAggregati.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a tabular attribute. The local columns specified will be individually aggregated
across all rows (including rows without linked records, which may be hidden in clients).
            
The returned aggregation will contain a list of the individual column aggregations that have been performed. Within these
column aggregations, the 'record count' instead denotes the number of relevant tabular rows across all records in the
aggregation scope, rather than the number of records. This row count will include rows that may be hidden from the user's
view in certain clients.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsLogicalAggreg.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a logical attribute. The returned aggregation will contain a count of records with at least one value for the attribute,
and a count of records for the true/false values.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsAttributeValu.description:
The results of aggregation over an attribute, reporting the number of records that have a value for
the attribute, plus additional aggregation information about the attribute values. The exact type of
additional information will depend on the type of attribute.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsAttributeExis.description:
The results of aggregation over an attribute, reporting only the number of records with a value
for the attribute.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsAttributeAggr.description:
A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific attribute or meta-attribute,
including summary information about the values assumed by the attribute.
            
For a numeric attribute (integer, point, range, or date-time), the summary information will
be the minimum and maximum values assumed by the attribute on some record.
            
For a simple text attribute (discrete, short-text), the summary information will be the most
common terms in the search index for that attribute.
            
This can also be used within the inner criteria of a 'link' attribute aggregation, to request
an aggregation over a local tabular column.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsAggregationDa.description: Inner criterion of an attribute search criterion for when the only bit of information about the datum that we want to convey is its type

GrantaServerApiAggregationsAttributeAggr.description: A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific attribute or meta-attribute.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsTermWithCount.description: A term from the search index, along with a count of how many times it occurs in some scope.

GrantaServerApiAggregationsValueWithCoun.description: A value from the search index, along with a count of how many times it occurs in some scope.

GrantaMISearchRecordPropertyFakeAttribut.description: Values that can be used in place of an attribute identity to perform a search, aggregation or export of a record property. RecordCreatedBy and RecordModifiedBy cannot be used in free text search or aggregation.
